intro: Fedia ovata, commonly known as the oval-leaf fedia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. Fedia ovata produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
